body.p: In the 2004 ED the Board acknowledged that entities within a group might not be able to identify a consistent and reliable basis for allocating the plan that results in the entity recognising an asset or liability that reflects the extent to which a surplus or deficit in the plan would affect its future contributions. This is because there may be uncertainty in the terms of the plan about how surpluses will be used or deficits funded across the consolidated group. However, the Board concluded that entities within a group should always be able to make at least a consistent and reasonable allocation, for example on the basis of a percentage of pensionable pay.
